title: RTE The Late Late Show line - up sees TikToker , rugby stars and Irish Women in Harmony join Patrick Kielty
body_text:
RTE The Late Late Show line-up sees TikToker, rugby stars and Irish Women in Harmony join Patrick Kielty
The Late Late Show will go ahead tonight despite the havoc wreaked by Storm Eowyn around the country
As the country continues to deal with the aftermath left in the wake of the devastating Storm Eowyn, the Late Late Show will go ahead as planned tonight, Friday January 24.
Host Patrick Kielty will provide the latest public advice on the severe weather and recap the damage that has been left by the brutal winds, which were the fastest on Irish record in some areas.
Joining Patrick at RTE studios will be Irish comedian, musician and viral TikTok star Garron Noone, who will discuss his meteoric rise to social media fame.
To mark 150 years since the establishment of the Irish Rugby Football Union and to preview the upcoming Six Nations tournament, Andy Farrell will make his Late Late Show debut to reflect on his time as Ireland's head coach, which saw him guide the national team to consecutive Six Nations titles. Farrell will also look ahead to his plans for the British and Irish Lions now that he has taken charge.
The rugby celebrations will continue with the appearances of rising stars Aoife Wafer, Erin King and Craig Casey, while former captain Rory Best will also be in attendance. Ex-Ireland and Leinster man Gordon D'Arcy is also due to join Patrick, along with best-selling author Paul Howard, to discuss their children's book partnership.
Music on the night comes from the Irish Women in Harmony group - comprising the likes of Ireland's top female artists Ruth Anne Cuningham, Erica Cody, Tolou, Aimée and Soulé, who will perform their own powerful version of Leonard Cohen's iconic song, Hallelujah.
